column4: I'm just getting back into linux, a re-newb; remind me of the terminal command to see the system processes in tree form, someone, please?
can someone point me to a nice linux beginner's guide, teaching commands and function in progressive steps from a pretty beginner level?
I'm a poor student living in a foreign country--something online please?
a google search will turn up many guides, butthis might be a bit better http://tldp.org/LDP/Bash-Beginners-Guide/html/index.html
unplug any other devices from usb that might be using too much power
unzipping as a normal user and then moving to /usr/src is a safer approach
more newb questions from someone who is obviously really rusty and never was that good in the first place: need to move all contents of a folder into another folder--best way to do this in terminal?

but how do I tell cp to select all of the contents? Does recursive (-r) do that? I wouldn't think so, but I don't see any other options, and I don't know exactly how to apply that. That you use -a is puzzling to me, also. feeling stupid and confused.
i use -a, which combines r and several other options... why dont you make a test directory and play with it a bit to see what works for you
I will certainly play some, I guess.
